p: Malondialdehyde is considered a presumptive biomarker for lipid peroxidation in live organisms (Mateos, Lecumberri, Ramos, Goya, & Bravo, 2005). In our study, dietary MOL decreased serum MDA. Oparinde and Atiba ( 2014) also observed that serum MDA was significantly lower in rats fed with Moringa oleifera than those with normal diet. Additionally, Moringa oleifera leaf and fruit extracts were found to reduce MDA levels both in vitro and in vivo (Luqman, Srivastava, Kumar, KumarMaurya, & Chanda, 2012). Previous studies demonstrated that the MOL possessed potent antioxidant properties due to its high contents of phenolic compounds and isothiocyanate (Tumer, Rojas‐Silva, Poulev, Raskin, & Waterman, 2015; Verma et al., 2009).
